intro: Silene birandiana, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Silene birandiana is an important species in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological balance.
